alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:55PM MDT until July 25 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN GARFIELD AND CENTRAL KANE COUNTIES... SPECIFICALLY FOR THE PARIA RIVER... At 655 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain fell over much of the upper headwaters region of the Paria River watershed. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams in the upper headwaters of the Paria River, with a flood wave anticipated to track down the Paria River and into the Paria Narrows by late this evening. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Henrieville, Cannonville and Kodachrome Basin State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
